answers.answer: Hi, im sorry to hear about your bad experience and so glad u came out good with a healthy baby.I had mild pre eclampsia and my docs advice for further pregnancies was contradictory basically if u had it ur more likely to get it again especially if u have the same partner but its more common in 1st time pregnancies.Sorry this is no help but i want to wish u all the best health for u and ur little one.Also im sure u will be closely monitored and looked after this time if u have had it previously. Good luck x

I had severe preeclampsia with my son who was my first. I am now pregnant with my second. As soon as I found out, they classified me as high risk. I have had many ultrasounds (due to other complications I had with my son) and they have done a lot of blood work along with a 24 hour urine. They did all of this so that they could monitor how I progress as the pregnancy progresses. Basically to have a baseline to compare to. They also have me being followed by a maternal fetal medicine specialist. I wish I could tell you more information on whether or not you or I will develop it again, but it is a wait and see process. I was high risk to develop it because my mother had severe preeclampsia when she was pregnant with me. So for though, this pregnancy has been pretty smooth (I am only 15 weeks). I wish the best for you, but my advice is for you to ask to be followed closely by your doctor and let them know immediately if you are having any symptoms of preeclampsia. Keep us updated and I am sure that all will be well! Congrats on your new little one soon to come!
Thank you Bev28 and BabyNuhu for your responses. Its good to kno im not alone with this. Ill keep you guys posted. My first appointment isnt till the 20th so Ill be paceing the floor till then!

im 26weeks +6 with my second and a high risk pregnancy due to preeclampsia. with my first i ended up having sn emergency c-section because they almost lost me and my daughter. i knew something wasnt right from 5 months on till i had my daughter. but the dr told me i was fine. dr knew the whole time what was wrong and didnt tell me. needless to my daughter is goin to be 8 in december and doin great. now pregnant with my second im high risk and being closely watched. so far everything is going good. i will have another c-section in december. this time around ive had two scares but everything turned out to be just fine. good luck to you and congrats. dont stress yourself out about it.

Wow thank you for shareing your story aswell. At first my doctor told me i shouldnt get pregnant again. Then he said I should wait around five years. But considuring that I feel like he was at fault for how bad I got because I believe he shouldnt of waited all weekend to et my reaults back to tell me I have severe preeclampsia, then waited three more days for me to have him naturally. Day four finally did a emergency csection. Next morning I couldnt breath. They tried cpaps and ned treatmeants but finially inbated me. Its hard to trust his judement. So here I am with a 13 month old and five weeks prego. Looking for the Best doctor in my area so we'll make it threw this time with less complications.

question: Id like to know if anyone has had serve preeclampsia and gone on to have a normal second pregnancy. I had to have my son a month early cause the preeclampisa got so bad.Then after three days in labor with him i ened up having a c section. After i had got fluid on my lungs so thay had to intibate me in a coma while i recoverd. This took 4 days in a coma. I didnt end up getting out of the hospital after three long weeks. The doctors even twll me I could of died.Needless to say Now that im pregnant again Im pretty scared that this might happen again. Anyone have any like stories...good or bad, Id love to know!
title: Helpp Im scared!
